etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin intercalat- ‘proclaimed as inserted in the calendar’, from the verb intercalare, from inter- ‘between’ + calare ‘proclaim solemnly’

definitions: interpolate (an intercalary period) in a calendar

examples.text: a system was introduced to intercalate an extra month in the calendar

definitions: insert (something) between layers in a crystal lattice, geological formation, or other structure

examples.text: the interlayer spaces of the graphite host lattice are filled with intercalated layers

shortDefinitions: insert something between layers in crystal lattice
